required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Heart Matters: The Effectiveness of Heart Health Education in Regions at Highest-risk.
clinical_study.official_title: Heart Matters: A Stepped-wedge Cluster Randomized Controlled Trial of Heart Health Education Targeting Communities at High Risk of Acute Coronary Syndrome.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the study is to evaluate whether providing a targeted heart health education campaign to regions at high risk of heart attacks will improve ACS patient's symptom recognition and response.
The intervention will be will be evaluated according to a cluster randomized, stepped wedged design. The clusters are eight local government areas (LGAs) in Victoria, Australia. The main primary outcome will be assessed in consecutive patients presenting to emergency departments from the six LGAs throughout the study period with an ED diagnoses of acute coronary syndrome.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The stepped-wedge design is a uni-directional cross-over design - where the randomisation element is when the cluster crosses-over to the intervention following a control period.
study_design_info.masking_description: Outcomes are collected blinded to the study allocation.

primary_outcome.description: The proportion of ACS patients that present to ED by ambulance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median ACS patient delay time
secondary_outcome.description: The median ACS patients delay time (time from symptom onset to decision to seek medical attention).

secondary_outcome.measure: ACS patient delay time <60 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of ACS patients with patient delay times <60 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Median ACS patient prehospital delay time
secondary_outcome.description: The median ACS patient prehospital delay time (time from symptom onset to arrival at hospital).

secondary_outcome.measure: ACS patients prehospital delay times <120 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of ACS patients with prehospital delay times <120 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Awareness of own risk of heart attack
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of adult members of the community who are aware of their own risk of heart attack.

secondary_outcome.measure: Awareness of heart attack as a leading cause of death
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of adult members of the community who identify heart disease a leading cause of death

secondary_outcome.measure: Awareness of heart attack risk factors
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of adult members of the community who identify cardiovascular risk factors

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of correctly named heart attack risk factors
secondary_outcome.description: The number of correctly named cardiovascular risk factors by adult members of the community

secondary_outcome.measure: Awareness of heart attack signs and symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of adult members of the community aware of heart attack symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of correctly named heart attack signs and symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: The number of correctly named ACS symptoms by adult members of the community

secondary_outcome.measure: Confidence in knowing how to act
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion adult members of the community who are confident about what they would do if experiencing a heart attack

secondary_outcome.measure: Ambulance use in scenarios
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion adult members of the community who correctly state they would call an ambulance for two heart attack scenarios.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of Heart Health Checks
secondary_outcome.description: Rates of Medicare claims for General Practitioner (GP) Heart Health Checks

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of ACS ED presentations
secondary_outcome.description: The rates of ED presentations that are ACS

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of unspecified chest pain ED presentations
secondary_outcome.description: Rates of ED presentations that are unspecified chest pain

secondary_outcome.measure: ACS ED presentations via GPs
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of ACS ED presentations via General Practitioners

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of ACS survival
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of ACS patients surviving to hospital discharge

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of OHCA
secondary_outcome.description: incidence of out-of-hospital cardiac arrest

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of OHCA
secondary_outcome.description: Rates out-of-hospital cardiac arrest survival

secondary_outcome.measure: Calls to ambulance for chest pain
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of chest pain (event type 10) calls to ambulance

secondary_outcome.measure: Calls to ambulance for non- chest pain
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of non-chest pain emergency calls to ambulance

arm_group.description: Intervention period with active Heart Matters education delivered
Control period with no Heart Matters education delivered.

intervention.description: Heart Matters coordinators will deliver heart health education to the community using HM materials and Partner resources.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: Adult residents of the eight local government areas -
Exclusion Criteria: Adults not residing in the eight local government areas.
-

patient_data.ipd_description: Access to data is restricted and is not available for sharing at the individual patient level.
